column4: I downloaded a file now I can't figure out how to find/run it.  what command can I use to find where a file is?
Rookie thanx
Rookie will the updatedb take a while? I put it in, it asked for the sudo pw, I gave it, now it's just sittin there...
Rookie okay I'll leave it be for a bit
Rookie should I run updatedb often? or will it do it it's self ever?
I like to run it in a nightly cron job
excuse my ignorance, this is my first nix system ever, just installed it yesterday, what's a cron job?
cron is a service that runs commands on a schedule.  nightly, for example.
is that something I have to script myself or is it build into gnome or something?
according to Rookie- it's already set up as a cron job, so not necessary
how did you download it
through the synoptics
what package
tintin++
tt++
if that works great, but how did you find that out so I can know how to find it if something similar happens again
it installs to /usr/games/tt++ (which is hopefully in your $PATH)
dpkg -L tintin++ to see a list of files installed by the package
okay, thanx
why won't it show up in my games menu under applications then? do I need to killall gnome?
possibly the package doesn't come with a menu entry
I'm not a gnome user, so I don't know how the menu works, but if it never does show up feel free to file a bug report on the package
